name: Mexican Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Wallpaper
description:
The elegant design of the Sugar Skull is representative of the Mexican Day of the Dead celebrations, where this folkloric skull is a ‘Memento Mori’ and has become an iconic symbol of life and death.
In this unique wallpaper, the intricately illustrated skull has been given a sophisticated twist by replicating it in gold on a rich matt dark charcoal, making it a luxurious addition to any interior.

Technical Information:
Roll size: 10m x 52cm
Pattern repeat: 53cm

Disclaimer:
Although we have tried our best to give the most accurate photographic representation of the wallpaper, we urge you to buy a sample to ensure you know what you are purchasing as returns will not be accepted unless the wallpaper is faulty. We are not liable for any damage or problems caused by faulty hanging. Hanging instructions are included with each purchase on the reverse of the label.
It is the responsibility of the customer to have correctly measured the amount of wallpaper needed, this is not a service we offer.

To buy a Sample, choose the 'Sample' option from the menu.

Photography by Nathan Pask

The elegant design of the Sugar Skull is representative of the Mexican Day of the Dead celebrations, where this folkloric skull is a ‘Memento Mori’ and has become an iconic symbol of life and death.

Each print is editioned out of 25 and signed by the artist (Emily Evans)
Size: 640mm X 480mm

Each print is editioned out of 20 and signed by the artist (Emily Evans)
Size: 640mm X 480mm

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Bone
description:
This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of longitudinal human bone tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy using colour phase technology. You can clearly see the osteocytes (bone cells) in bright red.

The scarf is made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem and measures 125cm X 125cm

The original histology slide is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
Product photography by Nathan Pask

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Scalp
description:
This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human scalp tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.
This section is cut through the dermis of the scalp. The dermis is the lower (or innermost) layer of the two layers that make up the skin, the other being the epidermis. The dermis contains hair follicles, sweat glands, sebaceous glands, blood vessels and lymph vessels. The section is cut tangentially in a plane +/- parallel to the skin surface. Hair follicles (blue and bright red circles) are observed in transverse sections on the left hand side, sebaceous glands are shown as pink masses and groups of sweat ducts are seen as patches of small dark blue circles, all of which are embedded in a matrix of blue collagen fibres. The right hand side is dominated by adipose tissue (fat), as white spaces among which are scattered hair follicles and groups of sweat glands. 

The scarf is made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem and measures 125cm X 125cm

The original histology slide is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
Product photography by Nathan Pask

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Brain
description:
This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human brain tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.
Transverse section of human cerebellum, LM silver-stained 
A light microscope brightfield image of a silver-stained transverse section through the human cerebellum. The large cell bodies belong to the Purkinje cells.

The scarf is made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem and measures 125cm X 125cm

The original histology slide is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
Product photography by Nathan Pask

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Skin
description:
This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human skin tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.
The human skin contains many layer, the outer layer being the epidermis and under this is the dermis. This image of the dermis layer of skin shows fibroblasts and thick collagen bundles (connective tissue). 

The scarf is made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem and measures 125cm X 125cm

The original histology slide is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
Product photography by Nathan Pask

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs / Scarves - Bone
description:
MORE BEING MADE - WILL BE IN STOCK JAN 2014

This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human bone tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.
The image shows the process of endochondral ossification (formation of bone) where cartilage cells (light blue) calcify to form newly formed bone (dark blue) and bone marrow (purple).

The scarf is made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem and is available in two sizes:

Hankerchief / Pocket square: 35 X 35cm 
Headscarf: 50 X 50cm

The original histology slide image is courtesy of LabGeek

IF SOLD OUT, PLEASE EMAIL INFO@ANATOMYBOUTIQUE.COM AS SCARVES WILL BE MADE TO ORDER IF NOT IN STOCK

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs / Scarves - Rectum
description:
MORE 50 x 50cm SCARVES BEING MADE - WILL BE IN STOCK JAN 2014

This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human Rectum, stained and examined with light microscopy.
The image shows a transverse section of rectum with groups of mucus-secreting 'goblet' cells surrounding a central duct. The mucus is stained with Alcian Blue.

The scarf is made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem and is available in two sizes:

Hankerchief / Pocket Square: 35 X 35cm
Headscarf: 50 X 50cm

The original histology slide is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs / Scarves - Cartilage
description:
MORE 50 x 50cm SCARVES BEING MADE - WILL BE IN STOCK JAN 2014

This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human cartilage tissue from the ear, stained and examined with light microscopy.
The image shows elastic cartilage in the centre (purple) surrounded by a network of collagen and elastin fibres (pink).

The scarf is made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem and is available in two sizes:

Hankerchief / Pocket Square: 35 X 35cm
Headscarf: 50 X 50cm

The original histology slide image is courtesy of Ivor Mason, Wellcome Images

name: Histology Silk Handkerchief / Scarf - Nail bed
description:
MORE ON ORDER - WILL BE IN STOCK JAN 2014

This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of human nail bed tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.

The scarf is made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem and is available in two sizes:

Hankerchief / Pocket Square: 35 X 35cm
Headscarf: 50 X 50cm

The original histological slide image is courtesy of LabGeek

name: Histology Silk Handkerchief / Neckerchief - Cat Testicle
description:
This 100% pure silk scarf is printed with the a slice of cat epididymis tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy.

The scarf is made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem and is available in one size:

Hankerchief: 35 X 35cm

The original histological slide image is courtesy of LabGeek

name: Sugar Skull Linen Fabric by the Metre
description:
This high quality linen fabric is suitable for all home upholstery; cushions, curtains, chair/sofa coverings.

Available in two colour ways;

Natural fabric background
Dark grey fabric background

Pattern Rpt: 53cm (pattern same size as wallpaper)
Width: 140cm

100% Linen
Dry Clean Only

Samples packs available.

Photography by Nathan Pask

name: NEW Human Taste Bud and Human Heart Histology Plates
description:
Histology: The study of the microscopic anatomy of cells and tissues.

'The way to a man's heart is through his taste buds!'

Human taste buds of the tongue and Human Cardiac muscle cells have been stained with haemotoxylin and eosin and magnified to show every cell.
These plates are available individually or in a set of two for a perfect gift.

The plates are 21cm (8") diameter made of bone china.

Histological slides provided by Spike Walker, Wellcome Images

name: Histology Plates - Individual
description:
Histology: The study of the microscopic anatomy of cells and tissues.

These plates are made from the actual images of prepared human tissue sections.

The plates are 21cm (8") diameter made of bone china.

Available in 8 different human tissue designs:
Thyroid, Bowel, Liver, Bone, Pancreas, Oesophagus, Testicle & Kidney.
Choose your designs from the drop down menu.

Sets of 4 plates are available (Testicle, Thyroid, Liver & Oesophagus) by returning to main menu and selecting the '4 Plate Set' option.

Although the plates are lovingly made by hand in London and every effort is made to ensure there is minor variation between batches, please be aware that slight differences may occur with each batch firing.

name: Histology Plates - Set of 4
description:
This set is comprised of the 4 most popular Histology Plates:
Testicle, Thyroid, Oesophagus, Liver

The plates are 21cm (8") diameter made of bone china.

Disclaimer:
Although the plates are lovingly made by hand in London and every effort is made to ensure there is minor variation between batches, please be aware that slight differences may occur between sets.

name: Histology Cup and Saucer
description:
Histology: The study of the microscopic anatomy of cells and tissues.

These straight sided tea/coffee cups are made from the actual images of prepared human tissue sections that have been expertly stained and photographed by a Histologist at Cambridge University.

The cups are 8.3cm (3.5") diameter with a design around the outside circumference, and the saucer is 15.5cm (6") diameter with the same design in the central cup well. Both are made of bone china.

Available in 4 different human tissue designs:
Thyroid, Bowel,  Oesophagus, & Testicle.
Choose your designs from the drop down menu.


Although the plates are lovingly made by hand in London and every effort is made to ensure there is minor variation between batches, please be aware that slight differences may occur with each batch firing.

name: Memento Mori II Giclee Print
description:
This pencil drawing 'Memento Mori’ is based on the Mexican Day of the Dead tradition of depicting the beautiful woman (Catrina) as a skull, representing the fact that death comes to us all, rich, poor or beautiful.

Giclee print in archival ink on 310 gsm 100% cotton museum grade paper, with beautifully warm off white tones and extreme texture.

Size: A3 - 420 x 297 mm
Editioned (Limited edition of 100) and signed by the artist

name: Anatomical Heart Necklace
description:
These sterling silver anatomical heart necklaces come in either blood red enamel or grey oxidised colours.

They are hand made by Devon based jeweller Helen Brice exclusively for Anatomy Boutique.
Each heart is engraved, cut, and enameled or oxidized by hand.
There are part of a limited edition of only 10 red and 5 grey ever made.
The reverse of each pendant is initialed with Helen's trademark.

Each pendant measures 31mm x 19mm and come on a silver 16″ chain.
